content.description: Route just to the right of Route#3.  A fun wandering route that follows varied natural features.  Starts up a right-leaning crack then traverses left across the face to the top. Crux is sidestepping left across a series of xenoliths (pebbles) to get to the left-hand crack.
content.protection: Draws.  A couple of longer runners will reduce rope drag on the traverse.  Chain anchors. Rap, lower or walk off.
content.location: Route in between route #3 and #4.

content.description: Begin climbing below and five feet left of a small tree growing from a seam thirty feet above the base. Climb rounded edges and features to the first bolt, above and left of the tree. It is possible to sling the tree, but it as quite insubstantial. Move up and left to a horizontal that accepts small 0.5 to #2 Camalots. Pull into a shallow depression and the second bolt. Continue trending up and left on friction and small edges past two more bolts and the final steep headwall section and the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchors.  A little sporty, but the bolts are well placed for protection.  Optional piece in the horizontal.
content.location: Far right side of the Corpse Wall. Just left of Christmas Chronicle. 2 bolt anchor has rap rings.

content.description: Climb the right-side bolted crack up the the slab.  Variations exist both right and left of the crack. Crux is the roof-move to the anchor. An (easier) variation to the finish exits up the far right side of the summit with better gear protection.
content.protection: 5 bolts + anchors.  Routes 7 and 8 were intended as mixed routes.  Small rack of cams up to #3 recommended if you want to protect the runouts, or forgo the gear to make it "sporty".  For a separate finish from the left #7 route stay to the right (skipping the last bolt) climbing discontinuous gear-protectable cracks to the anchor.
content.location: Right-side route of the obvious slab to the right of the central routes.  Shares an anchor with route #8.  Rap or walk off.

content.description: Fun little crack route to get some practice placing gear.  The first decent gear placement is 20' up after some easy climbing.
content.protection: standard rack up to 3".  Plenty of large nuts and offset cams wouldn't hurt.
content.location: Goes straight up the crack between route 7 and route 8.  Finishes on the same anchor with rap rings.

content.description: Face and discontinuous crack climbing up the left side of the slab.  Crux is the roof-move to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchors.  Routes 7 and 8 were intended as mixed routes.  Small rack of wires and cams up to #3 recommended if you want to protect the runouts, or forgo the gear to make it "sporty".
content.location: obvious slab to the right of the central routes.  Shares an anchor with route #8.

content.description: A variation start to the center routes that follows the right-side weaknesses.  It merges with route #5 at the 4th bolt and has the same finish.  A mixed-gear variation finishes up the big crack on the right.
content.protection:
7 bolts + anchors.  Well protected but optional gear in the .4-#2 range if you would like to protect the easy runouts.

A fun, alternate finish: clip the first three bolts then climb the large right-side crack which takes med to large gear.  Extra 3" helpful. I'd give the trad-finish an extra star.
content.location: Right-side central route that starts at the tree and shares the central anchor with routes 4 and 5.

content.description: Fun route with varied climbing.  Good warm-up route that shares an anchor with routes 4 and 6.  Small crux section is face below the anchor.  A few variations exist.
content.protection: 7 bolts + anchor.  Well protected where it is needed.  There are optional gear placements in the .4 - #2 range for the easy runouts.
content.location: Central route ending at the central anchor.  Starts up a crack to face and more discontinuous crack climbing. Rap or walk off.

content.description: Trad route up the crack between routes 4 and 5. Crack lends itself to right facing laybacks, lots of good pro placements. Clean the finger cracks for nuts.
content.protection: Standard rack up to fist. Anchor is two close bolts on the face left of the anchor for routes 4,5 and 6. Can walk off the top.
content.location: The crack opens to offwidth in a couple of places, start is the right leaning hand crack at the base left of route 5. There is a small bush in the crack about a third of the way up.

content.description: Left-center route.  Balancy start to techy face climbing with optional crack assist.  Traverse right at finish to the central shared anchor.  Edit to add: this climb now has an independent anchor for lead climbers.
content.protection: 6 bolts + anchor.  Optional #2 in the crack below the anchor.
content.location: Starts at a right-leaning seam to a face with a crack on your right.   This route is actually two routes to the right of Route #3 since a route (Xeno Dance)was added in between them. Using the crack makes it easier.  Shares the obvious anchor with routes 5 and 6.

content.description: Middle section of route feels a bit run out and wanders, looks like there are a couple of variations bolted on this route - but follow the left bolt line to the anchors.  This is a fun route despite the wandering nature.  I often wondered if the route was originally intended to be a mixed trad sport route as there are lots of cracks that could potentially be used for trad gear.  Although, the rock is a sandstone/conglomerate and rock strength could be an issue.
content.protection: 6-7 bolts to 3 bolt anchors with rap rings - shares anchors with Route 1 and 2.
content.location: 3rd route on wall from left - start is to the right of the big crack. Walk off or rappel.

content.description: The Roof Route is arguably the best route at the Corpse Wall. Scramble up the right side of the huge block to a stance below a bulge to clip the first bolt. Pull the awkward bulge and continue up the face as the face narrows to the base of a smooth slab. Work up the thin face, moving left to a small roof with large knobs. Climb the knobs to reach the right trending seam which is followed past two bolts to a short finger crack and the top.
content.protection: 10 bolts to an anchor consisting of two Fixe rings.
content.location: 2nd route from left on wall.  A bouldery start to 1st bolt just left of huge crack in wall.  Climb up past manzanita bush for 1st clip.  Walkoff  or 3 bolt anchor with rap rings.

content.description: The route follows an arete at the edge of the formation - comibnation of face and arete climbing.  The crux is moving through the last two bolts to the anchor.  An easier option is to stay left on the arete or move slight right for a harder finish up the face.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a three bolt anchor with rap rings.  The first bolt is approximately 15 feet off the ground with a bouldery start.  Double length runners can protect around the horns between bolts 2 and 3. Especially since the grade is easy-ish, leaders in this range might want to know how to make the climb more comfortable.
content.location: 1st route on the wall (left to right - looking at the wall). This route can be toproped as it is easy to hike to the top of the wall.

content.description:
More of a variation to Route #6 that has been recently cleaned and is quite fun.

This route shares the first three bolts and the anchor with "Route #6". Climb past the tree, then cut right to an obvious crack and follow to the top. Traverse left to the shared anchor.

This is a great route for beginner trad leaders, as the first part is bolt-protected, and there are plenty of gear placements the rest of the climb.
content.protection: 3 bolts and gear to 3-1/2" - 4". Bring longer runners for the top.
content.location: Right center of Corpse Wall. There is a tree at 20 feet.

climbs.name: Proud Mary
climbs.fa: Ben Chapman, Pam Neal, & Jeffrey Thomas (06-18-15)

content.description: Begin climbing the partially detached flake to its top (optional .3-.75 C4s). Move up and right on the face to a large hueco. From the hueco climb up the face and use the seam/crack above the ledge to gain a 4th bolt (the 5th bolt of "Xeno Dance"). Continue up and right on the face using small features and scoops. As the face steepens smear and use features to reach the last bolt at a thin seam. Use the seam and crescent shaped scoops to reach a final mantle into the recess at the top and the anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts (shares 5th bolt with Xeno Dance) & 2-ring Fixe anchor.
content.location: Ten feet left of "Xeno Dance." Right of the huge chimney that splits the left side of the Corpse Wall. Start at the base of a reddish tinted flake with a serrated right edge.

content.description: Climb the blocky broken pillar between two bushes, just right of the center of the Corpse Wall. Above the 1st bolt work up and right on shallow cracks and scoops to a large block that forms a finger crack. From the top of the block move left onto the face and palm the edge of the wide crack on the left and knobs to the top.
content.protection: 7 bolts & Fixe 2-ring anchor.
content.location: Begin in the broken blocky area between the Scrub Oak & Manzanita bush just right of the middle of the wall. Between routes 6 & 7. Parallels Richards Rift at the top.

content.description: Feeling like you don't fit in with all those weird slab climbers?  The Outsider is your answer.  After three easy bolts, clip a permadraw and pull into a huge juggy hueco.  Follow the vertical rail up the left to it's top (There's a kneebar if you want it) and shoot out to a smaller hueco on the face.  Enjoy a short hard crux.
content.protection: 8 bolts
content.location: Across the trail from the main slab wall on the overhanging pocketed face

content.description: Begin climbing at a large depression or recess that forms an overhang at its top, 15 ft above the base. Stem the edges of the recess to pull over the overhang and a slot for gear. Continue up the silvery lichen streaked face on sidepulls and features past two more bolts. Another wide crack/slot offers a large cam placement which leads to a last bolt and the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts & cams (#1 - #2)
content.location: Between Route 8 and Route 9. Marked as the 2nd prominent silvery lichen streak to the right. Below the large gap in the clifftop right of the tree.

content.description: From a small boulder at the base of the wall pull cobbles to a deep pocket. Mantle and side pull to surmount a shelf under the bulge. Pull the bulge on a shallow scoop and an array of pebbles of questionable integrity. Once established above the bulge continue pulling cobbles and features up a shallow corner to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts & steel carabiner style anchor.
content.location: Ten feet right of "Cobble Me a Climb."

content.description: Climb past an arch and balance/reach/jump (?) through the crux roof (5.10d). The moves through the roof may be more difficult for those of shorter stature. Continue up slabby moves and fun moderate climbing to a second tricky move and a unique hold,then balance up to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chain anchors.
content.location:
Located on the far right side of the Saddle Peak/Corpse Wall formation.

Just right of Route 10.

content.description: Direct finish to Xeno Dance or Route #4. Continue straight up through some spicy 5.10 to an insecure but well-protected boulder problem crux at the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts or easy TR setup
content.location: Directly above the starts of Xeno Dance and #4, right of Proud Mary

content.description: Follow the left-most bolt line on the cobbled face. There is a cruxy traverse left immediately after clipping the first bolt. If a cobble is less than the size of a golf ball it should be viewed with suspicion. The larger cobbles feel quite solid
content.protection: 5 bolts, helmet
content.location: This route is on the first of the two large boulders on the left side of the trail about 3/4 of the way along the approach trail that passes the water tower.  If you hit the high point of the approach you've gone a about 50-100 yards too far.

content.description: Short but high-quality slapping up both sides of a steep featured arete on the right side of Halfway Rock
content.protection: 5 bolts, ClimbTech hook anchor
content.location: 8' right of Morpheus in a secluded little alcove just off the trail on the way to Corpse Wall

content.description: Face and steep balancy slab climbing.  Tricky moves after the first bolt and a gripping top out.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchors.  Sporty.  1 Optional piece to protect the lower crack.
content.location: Far right side of the Corpse Wall.  This is the second to last climb on the wall. 2 bolt anchor has rap rings

content.description:
The odd old bolted/mixed route that heads up the huge blocks and gully just right of the Roof Route. Share's the start of #3 (clip the left bolt at the roof) then gully-hop, traversing left while clipping the 2 bolts on top of the big blocks. Ends straight up a crack with a manzanita growing out of it. (Shown as the dotted line "var" on the beta map).

Pretty grungy with some loose rock in the gulleys.  There are a couple of moves off the blocks some folks may find fun, but the topout around the bush is gritty and awkward.  NOTE: Cutting manzaninta is illegal so please don't kill the bush to facilitate a mediocre climb.

For a more interesting finish... just keep traversing left to link up and top out on the #2 Roof Route.  Watch your rope-end on the lower.  Not sure if 60m makes it to the ground.
content.protection: Draws.  A couple of mid-size cams to protect the runout crack at the top.
content.location: This is the bolted gully between the #2 "Roof Route" and the #3 Route.

content.description: Climb up under the overhang and grasp the undercling. Locate secure holds above the roof from which you can clip the first bolt. Pull the roof and continue climbing up features to a ledge. Climb up to a crack that angles up to the left and provides nice edges or pods. Clip the last bolt and pull edges to the anchor. Once you solve the mystery of how to haul yourself over the overhang you'll appreciate the route's name. A bit puzzling.
content.protection: 4 bolts & 2-ring anchor.
content.location: Far right end of the Corpse Wall.
